title: Debenhams names former Game and House of Fraser finance boss as new chairman
text:
Embattled department store chain Debenhams has appointed the former finance chief of House of Fraser and Game as its new chairman.

Following recent speculation, Celine Jersey Topco Limited - the the consortium of investors and lenders that took control of Debenhams earlier this year when it fell into administration - has confirmed Mark Gifford will take the job.

'We are delighted that Mark will be joining the parent board to work with our investor consortium, who have confirmed their continuing commitment through providing additional liquidity for our peak trading,' said Debenhams' new chief executive Stefaan Vansteenkiste, who replaced Sergio Bucher in August.

Mark Gifford will help to lead the turnaround of the department store chain, which fell into administration earlier this year

'Mark's expertise and understanding of business change as well as the retail industry will be invaluable.'

Gifford will help to lead the turnaround of the department store chain. He was chief finance officer of Game Digital from 2015 to 2018 and held the same role at House of Fraser for the previous eight years.

Gifford is also currently chairman of accessories brand Radley and is a non-executive director of Ann Summers' owner GGI.

His appointment comes as Debenhams is going through a restructuring, having launched a Company's Voluntary Arrangement in spring and announced the planned closure of 50 of its 166 UK stores.

Last month, it won a High Court challenge against landlords who tried to scupper its plans to close stores, reduce rents and cut jobs in a bid to revive its fortunes.

Billionaire retail tycoon Mike Ashley, who runs Sports Direct, helped finance Debenhams' landlords' efforts to overturn the department store group's restructuring plan.

The first 22 stores are set to close down in January next year and 1,200 staff would be affected by the first phase.

Gifford said: 'I am excited about the opportunity to play a part in building a successful future for one of the UK's best-known retail businesses.

'We are assembling a strong group of board members and I am looking forward to working with the team as we implement the necessary changes to deliver a sustainable and profitable future.'
